creator: mslinn@mslinn.com
text:
tld entry for tag attribute is:
        <attribute>
            <name>cssFile</name>
            <required>true</required>
            <rtexprvalue>true</rtexprvalue>
        </attribute>

Sample usage of tag in JSP:
<jbc:useCss cssFile='<%=getServletContext().getRealPath("EN.css")%>'>

Problem: Attribute is not evaluated at runtime, but is passed literally, as if 
rtexprvalue was not specified, or was set to false.  I briefly looked through 
the TomCat source code, and it seemed to me like rtexprvalue was not acted upon.

TomCat V3.2 and V3.2.1 exhibit the identical bug.

creator: mslinn@mslinn.com
text:
As you can see from the accompanying sample source code and runtime output, the 
runtime computation of the attributes of a tag library is not performed for the 
MyTagExtraInfo.getVariableInfo() method (they are passed literally), but they 
are performed for the MyTag.doStartTag() method.  Unfortunately, since the 
TagExtraInfo class derives from Object, and loads by means of its own class 
loader, it is in a different namespace, with no access to the pageContext.  
This means that TagExtraInfo class can't communicate easily with the servlet or 
the JSP.  The result of this limitation is that taglibs can't be implemented 
that rely on a runtime parameter or pageContext to generate scripting 
variables.  I have a need for such an ability, and the workarounds that I have 
been able to come up with so far are fairly horrible.

Mike
